Comments
There are campus police and police in training, it doesn't get much safer than that.
It's great for art students and students interested in ag or wild life. There are also great programs for nursing, police, and fire fighters.
The main campus is on a wild life refuge, so there's a creek and fields, and lots of wild life all around, especially deer and 100's of species of song birds.
Since it's a community college it isn't too expensive, with so many options it's worth the money.
There's a new student lounge on the main campus, a great place to read, do homework, or use your laptop since there is wifi.
The foods ok, kind of expensive though.
I'm not sure there are dorms.
Like most schools, some classes are difficult and some are easy; it all depends on the student and professor.
Make sure to talk to the counselors and head of the department of what you are majoring in to keep yourself on track.
Butte College has many area's of study. It has a very nice environment. Having different campuses make's it easier for more people to attend that otherwise couldn't go to the main campus.
pageTitle: Butte College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {284722=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 124846=The orientation I attended on 8/14/2012 was a great source of knowledge as to how the school operates. I am proud to know that I will be attending such a great school offering so much in terms of education. I can honestly say that I cannot wait to start the school year. I have been out of school since 2000 after graduating from High School. I am eager to kick start my career in becoming a fire fighter. From what I hear, Butte College offers the best fire academy in the state of California. To hear that makes me proud to know that I will one day be a first class fire fighter to graduate from a prestigious academy., 127655=Lots of financial aid available, there is even a scholarship office. I joke that you don't need financial aid because the cost of the college itself is so cheap: less than $1500 per semester.}

textAfterTable: Bang for the buck Excellent education for nothing near the price at a University. What to do for fun Chico is right down the road from the main campus and has tons to do on your off days. They have a huge beautiful park that runs through the whole town and a very happening downtown scene. Food and Dining The on campus cafeteria serves a large variety food and Chico has almost every type of restaurant you could ask for. Dorm Life I don't know much about dorm life but there is a wide variety of students attending Butte so there is a place for everyone. Academic Rigor This college is all about a higher learning. It is a great school and is very flexible with classes that fit everyone. Tips for prospective students Definitely see a counselor and make sure to enroll and register as soon as you can.
